greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of factorizations of numbers that are not perfect powers using only numbers that are not perfect powers.
comment: Note that a factorization of a number that is not a perfect power (A007916) is always itself aperiodic, meaning the multiplicities of its factors are relatively prime.
mathematica: radQ[n_] := And[n > 1, GCD@@FactorInteger[n][[All, 2]] === 1]; facsr[n_] := If[n <= 1, {{}}, Join@@Table[Map[Prepend[#, d] &, Select[facsr[n/d], Min@@# >= d &]], {d, Select[Divisors[n], radQ]}]]; Table[Length[facsr[n]], {n, Select[Range[100], radQ]}]
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Apr 29 2018
